Commenting to save this thread for later. I'm 23, and I want to be a TV writer. I'm moving to Burbank at the end of this month. Feel free to DM, I'm looking for help/support/networking and just a general person in the same boat. Good luck and maybe I'll see you soon.

WRITING.TITLE: What's a good rate?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I'm a freelance column writer and screenwriter. I just got a break with a production company. They're asking me for a feature length script. Since most of my screenwriting experience has been with comedy shorts, and commercials. I don't really know what to ask for in terms of pay. This is my first feature length (with someone's story and guidelines), I don't want to high-ball them but I also don't want to be taken advantage of. What do you guys think?

I graduated a year ago with a degree in film production, since graduation I worked at a small production company in south Florida. I just quit to pursue screenwriting full time. I want to eventually move to LA. How hard is it to get a writer assistant job? How hard it it to become a script doctor? WRITING.TEXT: Mr. Blonde - Reservoir Dogs

I'm working a production job right now and I hate it. I actually just gave them a months notice. I started this job with the intention of getting experience before I move to LA. I got the experience I want/need and now I plan my next step. I would like to focus on my writing for a good 6 months and treat that as my full time job. I get it, it's a weird feeling, quitting a job that pays and so forth. As long as you do what's best for you and stay focused on your goals.
What advice do you have for an aspiring screen writer? I'm quitting my full time production job to spend more time writing. Any tips to stay motivated? Big fan, btw.

Pro for sure is that she sounds great.

WRITING.TITLE: Tuning
WRITING.TEXT: I've heard a few things from a bunch of people. I'm looking to wrap my pipes and change the headers on my 2009 Thruxton. I was planning on purchasing the BC Predator Shorty exhaust headers. If I change those and wrap my pipes at the same time, will I have to tune my engine differently?
This one too! coffee everywhere.
I'm at work and just spilled coffee all over myself laughing so hard at this comment.
Car hole!

I actually bought the NRC Fender Eliminator Kit as soon as I bought my Thruxton. It's been about 6 months and they work fine. It makes taking the seat off a little bit more difficult but they look great and they're very bright. Plus if you google discount codes for NRC you can snag a pretty sweet promo code. Right before I bought mine I got like 30 percent of the total order.
I live in south Florida so the majority of roads around me are all grids. A few hours up north is nice though.
Super jealous. I'm from Delaware originally but since I've had my Thruxton I've been in Florida. I miss the winding roads like those.
